docs.snippet: The celebrity tabloids continue to pick apart Tom Cruise;  moviegoers continue not to care . “Oblivion,”  Mr. Cruise’s latest big-screen adventure , was a stronger-than-expected No. 1 at North American theaters over the weeken...
docs.lead_paragraph:
The celebrity tabloids continue to pick apart Tom Cruise; moviegoers continue not to care . “Oblivion,” Mr. Cruise’s latest big-screen adventure , was a stronger-than-expected No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, with ticket sales of about $38.2 million. 
 
The PG-13 film, a dystopian science fiction thriller, has already taken in $112 million overseas, giving Mr. Cruise another global hit. “Oblivion” was expensive to make, however. Universal Pictures said it cost $120 million, but the Hollywood trade news site Deadline.com reported that the total budget may have been sharply higher.

docs.snippet:
New York City is invited to a poetry reading.
   
There is no velvet rope to traverse, no waiting in line and no entrance fee. Instead, the poets take their works to New Yorkers: on trains and ferries, in stores, on the street, and in park...
docs.lead_paragraph:
New York City is invited to a poetry reading.
 
There is no velvet rope to traverse, no waiting in line and no entrance fee. Instead, the poets take their works to New Yorkers: on trains and ferries, in stores, on the street, and in parks and laundromats.
docs.abstract: City Room blog; Poets in Unexpected Places is a group of poets deliver who their works, a mix of music and verse, in public areas across New York City, from subway cars to laundromats and parks. Photos (M)

headline.main: Adding Verse And Meter To the Drone Of the City

docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column notes that while motivation of Boston Marathon bombing suspects has yet to be revealed, their intent at least in part was to disrupt exactly what events like the marathon celebrate: the American given, as found along race's 26.2-mile route.

headline.seo: On Boston Marathon Route, Main Streets and a New Kind of Heartbreak

docs.snippet:
HOPKINTON, Mass.
   
It all starts here, as Hopkinton likes to say. And last week, once again, thousands of marathoners formed a block of Main Street determination that stretched past the Town Common’s spring grass, and the Korean P...
docs.lead_paragraph:
HOPKINTON, Mass.
 
It all starts here, as Hopkinton likes to say. And last week, once again, thousands of marathoners formed a block of Main Street determination that stretched past the Town Common’s spring grass, and the Korean Presbyterian Church’s white spire, and the public library offering brief amnesty for overdue items, and the Lovely Lady salon, on and on.
docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column notes that while motivation of Boston Marathon bombing suspects has yet to be revealed, their intent at least in part was to disrupt exactly what events like the marathon celebrate: the American given, as found along race's 26.2-mile route. Map, Photos (M)

headline.main: Along the Route, Main Streets, Hills and a New Kind of Heartbreak
